key_points: Michigan high school shooting results in four students killed.
15-year-old Ethan Crumbley charged with 24 crimes including terrorism causing death.
Austin Witt, a senior at Oxford High, remembers victim Tate Myre as the 'heart and soul' of their community.
Investigators found digital evidence suggesting Crumbley planned the attack, including a video and journal detailing his intent.
A social media post showed the gun used in the attack, purchased four days before the incident.
Oakland County prosecutor Karen McDonald insists charging Crumbley as an adult is essential for justice.
McDonald highlights the trauma experienced by surviving students as a reason for serious charges.
The shooting began when Crumbley emerged from a bathroom with a gun and began firing in the hallway.
Senior Mitchell Williams describes the event as 'horrific,' underlining the confusion and fear during the shooting.
The community is mourning the loss and grappling with the impact of the tragedy.
